author: Michael East
title: French artist Abraham Poincheval entombs himself inside giant boulder 'to find out what the world is'
text:
French artist Abraham Poincheval entombs himself inside giant boulder 'to find out what the world is' French artist Abraham Poincheval poses inside his artwork Pierre ("Stone") in Paris, France, February 2 Michael East 22 February 2017 • 1:39pm 
F rench artist Abraham Poincheval, who previously made headlines for inventing a pill to make flatulence smell of roses , has entombed himself in a 12-tonne limestone boulder, where he plans to stay for a week. 
He will then use his body heat in an attempt to hatch a dozen eggs. 
The performance entitled "Stone" is "an inner journey to find out what the world is,” said Poincheval who has carved out a human shaped hole in the boulder. 
Jean de Loisy, curator of the Palais de Tokyo, a modern art museum in Paris, maintained that Poincheval's work should not be thought of as stunts but as a series of mystical journeys. 
They are profound meditations on "inner exploration, on modifying the self and of living in other realms beyond our own," the curator said. #AbrahamPoincheval entre à l'instant dans sa pierre. Il y restera enfermé pendant 7 jours et 7 nuits. pic.twitter.com/jmUtC5u6GN — Palais de Tokyo (@PalaisdeTokyo) February 22, 2017 
D uring an interview with AFP, the artist said that he has spent a considerable amount of time preparing himself mentally and physically for the practicalities of life within a boulder. He will be sustained on dried meat, cartons of soup and other liquids. 
When asked about how he will go to the toilet, the artist was reportedly evasive. 
He is not concerned about loneliness as many people spoke to him during a similar rock-based performance in Marseille. So many people came to "talk to the stone" that security guards had to be called in to ensure the artist could sleep at night. À quelques minutes de l'entrée d' #AbrahamPoincheval dans sa pierre... pic.twitter.com/WAWVfYnSAN — Palais de Tokyo (@PalaisdeTokyo) February 22, 2017 
F ormer solitary confinement prisoners kept him company and a young girl talked to him "about the violin she had just bought for three hours.” 
According to Poincheval, the end of previous performances has been marked by a “day in the dumps... and a lot of turbulence inside. It takes several weeks to get back to normal,” he said. 
Upon completion of the week long entombment, Poincheval plans to sit on a dozen eggs for approximately four weeks until they hatch, in a performance called "Egg." — Siobhán Silke (@siobh_ie) February 22, 2017 
H e will have a half an hour break every 24 hours and his diet will be rich in ginger so that he can keep the eggs at a minimum of 37 degrees Celsius; ginger expands blood vessels which increases body heat. 
The chicks that hatch "will go and live with my parents" said the artist. 
Poincheval is known for his unusual performances. Previously he has spent two weeks inside a stuffed bear, spent a week on top of a 20 metre pole, navigated a river in a corked bottle and has crossed France on foot in a straight line. — Paris HELPLINE (@parishelpline) February 20, 2017
